intro: Gypsophila pseudopallida, commonly known as the pale gypsophila, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its stems are usually slender and branching, with small, linear leaves. Gypsophila pseudopallida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
